name: The Ponds at Foxhollow

reviews.text: We stayed here for a girls' weekend and were drawn to this property because of its amenities such as a kitchenette, jacuzzi tub and TV/DVD player. It was great to be able to have breakfast in the room. The grounds were nice. The couches are a bit worn and not particularly comfortable and neither was the bed but that could just as easily be the case in a hotel room as well. We weren't able to take advantage of all of the features the property offers (indoor pool, games, movies available to borrow, etc.) and look forward to taking advantage of them when we have another opportunity to return.
reviews.title: Girls' Weekend

reviews.text: This resort is very nice, comfortable with great views from the balcony. Second bedroom is a loft with its own living room and bath. Also has a working fireplace. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though the resort is old, it is very well maintained.
reviews.title: Perfect getaway.

reviews.text: We would stay there again!
reviews.title: Perfect for what it was meant to me

reviews.text: We stayed here last weekend in a 2-bedroom unit to use it as home base for a weekend trip to Butternut. While the unit is technically a sleep-6, we actually had a dozen people (6 adults and 6 children). The unit has 1 bedroom on the first floor, along with a sleeper sofa in the living room; upstairs is another sleeper sofa and a second bedroom. There was plenty of room for everyone since most of the children slept in sleeping bags. Other reviews are correct that the units are dated. However, we found it to be clean, which is most important. The place is a 15 minute drive to Butternut, which is very convenient. The clubhouse has an indoor pool, which the children enjoyed. Wi-fi in the units (unsecured). A few recommendations if you are going to stay here...First, the units have a fireplace in which you are allowed to burn only artificial logs - they sell small 2-hour logs at the front desk for $3 apiece, but you could probably bring better ones to save a little money. Secondly, while the clubhouse provides pool towels, they are small so you may want to bring your own. Lastly, my wife found the sheets to be of low quality - if you want to improve your experience, you may want to bring your own sheets. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would certainly return for another ski weekend.
reviews.title: Old, needs upgrades, uncomfortable layout and furnishings.

reviews.text: Nice location in the berkshires but an old property with units that remind me of a low-end hotel. Low end furnishings in need of an upgrade. If you like cheap oak this is the place for you. Clubhouse is also old and in need of an upgrade. Did an exchange for this and the property is very inferior to my marriott unit.
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds, Decent Unit

reviews.text: We stayed here a week before Thanksgiving so it was already pretty cold. We traveled with our five month old baby and it was relaxing. We came at a time when it was very quiet. We had the pool to ourselves every time we visited. The rooms were very spacious. The resort and grounds were very well kept. Yes, the rooms were a bit dated but definitely adequate for a timeshare. The heating was hit or miss but we were never freezing cold. I would recommend this place to stay. The location is like a little retreat. The drive to all the towns nearby were very convenient.
reviews.title: Very nice and relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was not the greatest but enjoyed the pool. There was a very nice wine and cheese reception Friday night in their clubhouse room. Did not do much else since my husband came down with a bad cold. The unit was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Could use some updating. Be aware that the 2 bedroom units are up quite a few stairs if you have trouble climbing steps with luggage, food,etc.
reviews.title: Nice Relaxing Week

reviews.text: Very nice grounds. Nice & quiet all around. Loved the get together with other folks. That was nice & the staff were very friendly. Overall, this is a very nice place, but, needs a lot of improvement. The furniture doesn't fit in the room. Very uncomfortable too small. The heat was not properly working. Hot air then freezing cold. The bath tub was sunk in, you couldn't put any showering proucts in there. The toilet overflow everytime you flushed it. The fireplace worked, but, the couch was cramped in a cubby hole you couln't even fix it to make it comfortable. The bed was comfortable. Need to hang curtains for room darkner. The sheets were terrible. Not to mention, there was a very musty oder in the Unit. Needs to make a lot of changes & in need of an interior decorater. So darn cramped in a hole in a 2 bedroom Unit. We were only 2 people. This is the worst place we ever been to. Never again.
reviews.title: The Ponds at Foxhollow, Lenox Mass
Great timeshare
reviews.text: I just came back after spending a week in a 2 bedroom unit. I was a bit skeptical after reading everyone's reviews but I must say we had a great time. The unit was huge. The kids slept upstairs, we were in the master bedroom and my inlaws came for 2 nights and slept in the loft. It was very spacious. While its no Marriott Timeshare I must say I was impressed. The grounds are beautiful and have plenty for the kids to do including tennis, outdoor, indoor pool, paddle boat and a playground. This was my first time to the Berkshires. the timeshare is located centrally to many attractions. We went to Six Flags which took about an hour. We also went to the lake which was 5 minutes away and saw a concert at tanglewood. The only thing I wish the timeshare had was a place to get food. I would definitely go back the next time I'm in the Berkshires.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two very enjoyable weeks at Ponds at Fox Hollow in Lenox this summer. The Ponds is centrally located off Route 7 to the entire Berkshires area and of course to the music at Tanglewood.It is also close to a neat nine hole public golf course and all of the good restaurants in the Lenox area.The Ponds offers condo rentals of one and two bed rooms which are roomy and quite attractive for either couples or large families with children. The grounds are beautiful and offer scenic views to wander or run in . The place needs some attention to make it a really great attraction . The interior roads are full of giant pot holes and the beds in the cottages would benefit from replacement of lumpy mattresses. However,the positives far outweigh the negatives and for over all value for the cost we would definitely return to the Ponds if we travel to the berkshires.
reviews.title: A great Vacation in the Berkshires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a lot of space for the money. And they've finally upgraded the TV system. But the sheets are horrible, as another reviewer pointed out. The mattresses, although relatively new, are squishy, and not supportive enough.
reviews.title: Time for them to put some money into this place.

reviews.text: It's a good place to spend some time, as it is quiet, clean although worn, and the amenities are good. But management needs to think about painting and decorating. And getting new sheets.
reviews.title: Roomy and comfortable in a terrific location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe next year I'll bring my own. Might be worth the trouble.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Great place to stay in the Berkshires
reviews.text: The Ponds is conveniently located near Tanglewood (10-12 minutes away) and other Berkshire attractions. During a hot week in July two couples were comfortable in the upper floor roomy 2-BR units. Free wi-fi worked great. AC in all rooms was strong and dependable. Outdoor pool is clean and refreshing but offers little shade and is surrounded by chainlink fence with multiple signs announcing the absence of a lifeguard. Provided pool towels are small. Indoor pool is like a sauna and not very inviting in summer. Free washer/dryers for each two units are terrific. Open alley kitchen with limited counter space but with more than adequate equipment: stove, full-size refrigerator, cabinets with pots and pans and eating and cooking utensils. Acres of undeveloped grounds are great for walking. Cons: a bit outdated design of furnishings and units.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend made reservation at this hotel after reading TripAdvisor reviews. We stayed here only 1 night and we were highly disappointed. We received poor services and cold response from the staff. Paid too much money for the hotel with no stars.
reviews.title: Lovely escape

reviews.text: In planning our trip to the Berkshires, we were looking for a family-oriented place to stay that would be close to major attractions, yet secluded enough to give us some alone time with our new baby (who, heading into the Memorial Day weekend, was only 4 months old). The Ponds at Foxhollow perfectly fit our needs – it was only 5 minutes away from one of the major attractions in the area – the Edith Wharton estate – as well as only 10 minutes away from both Tanglewood and the town of Lenox, which we had always heard was one of the best towns in the Berkshires. (Hint: the Canyon Ranch Spa – typically ranked among the best spas in the nation - is in Lenox)
reviews.title: Wonderful trip to the Berkshires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Foxhollow – which was apparently a former retreat for scions of the great New York City families back in the day (i.e. folks like Edith Wharton) – did not disappoint. We had a two-room condo with a private backyard patio that had a view of a private lake. Within the Foxhollow complex, there was also a pool, a health club and tennis courts, not to mention trails for walking. Foxhollow is itself set far back from the road, and bordered by hedges, trees, and a long, winding path accessible by both car and bike. We loved this privacy and seclusion – but if you’re planning on walking to a restaurant – or even to a grocery – late at night you’ll be out of luck. You’ll need to hop in your car and hit one of the nearby towns – the drive isn’t bad at all, but we definitely stocked up on our arrival night with food and beverages.
reviews.title: Terrible place

reviews.text: For a relaxing, scenic stay in the Berkshires, I would readily recommend Foxhollow. The booking system is not Web-enabled, and that gave us cause for concern before arriving, but the staff was extremely helpful (even offering to help us assemble our borrowed baby travel crib). All the amenities were modern, but the charm and feeling of the place hearkened back to an Age of Innocence.
reviews.title: A fine choice in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel quite a bit an this place was VERY disappointing. the grounds are beautiful however don't be fooled. The interior of these condos are a trip to 1980. When I called the Gen Manager to complain about the shower head where the water hits your face like bullets, or the fact we were there 2 days yet only got one coffee packet , and you were only allowed 1, thats 1 set of towel for 2 nights, his response was 'oh well'. I mean really.....he was basically like 'too bad.' When I stated my dissatisfaction, he was not willing to help me out. When I stated I was going to write a letter, he said go ahead, its your perogative. REALLY!!! For $300 p/night I expected SO MUCH MORE. I would NEVER stay there again, nor would I recommend it to anyone. I think you would get better service at the Quaiity Inn down the street. Maybe the Gen Manager Ed, should watch the movie 'Give them the Pickle' . Its all about customer service!!!!!!
reviews.title: Charming Relaxing Getaway

reviews.text: We very much like the Ponds and stay there at least once a year--and we're looking forward to spending more weeks there in the future.
reviews.title: Winter wonderland
